Villar, Arturo: Interview (with His Wife, Jorgina)
Villar, Arturo: Interview (with His Wife, Jorgina)

This video begins with an interview with Arturo Villar. He discusses his insights on what drove the balseros, people who traveled via makeshift rafts from Cuba to the United States, as well the Marielitos (refugees of the 1980 Mariel boatlift). He also discusses the creation of Radio Progeso in Miami. The second half the video contains an interview of Arturo and his wife, Jorgina, together. Jorgina talks about when they left Cuba to live in Spain, Puerto Rico, and Miami, and her subsequent visits to Cuba. At the end of the video, there are close-up shots of Arturo and conversations with his wife and the interviewers.
Arturo Villar was a former journalist who advised businesses about opportunities in the Cuban economy. He left Cuba after the revolution, but expressed his desire to return.
Villar, Arturo: Interview (with His Wife, Jorgina): circa 1991-1992
